page.title: 07PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: There are several old and interesting places to visit in our area, but probably the most famous house in the{ {Shibden Valley}is Shibden Hall, in Shibden Park. The park is just south of Stump Cross on our map but the house is shown on the area immediately south of ours. The Conservative Club at{Northowram}was once the old Bell School, which was the first school in the area, over 200 years ago. The original bell is still displayed in the club. Several other interesting houses, not open to the public however, include Scout Hall, Upper Shibden Hall, Lee House, and Dan House. The Shibden Mill Inn is also very interesting, and was the scene of a Luddite attack, the original mill being burnt down in the early 19th century.
